channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WV

item.title: Report E-2023110528
item.description:
Report E-2023110528

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-23
  • City: BELLE
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 275 gallon totes of depositrol BL5600 (un3265) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 100 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023110504
item.description:
Report E-2023110504

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-23
  • City: BELLE
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, a 330-gallon tote containing (UN3265) DEPOSITROL BL5600 was punctured by a pallet likely due to inadequate preparation for transportation. Approximately 100-gallons of product released onto the dock, the trailer floor, and the asphalt beneath the trailer. A contractor cleaned-up the release and performed a tote transfer. No storm drains, waster ways, or soil were impacted by the spill.
